peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I know if my light fixture is antique?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: A good place to start is by examining the materials used to make the light fixture. Antique lights are typically made of brass, bronze, or copper, and they often feature intricate designs and patterns. Another clue to identifying antique lights is the style of the fixture.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What are Antique Lights? - TEKLED

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How old does a lamp have to be to be an antique?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: According to the antique industry, the common consensus is that for a work to be accurately labeled an antique, it must be at least one hundred years old. This rule is for any item, including furniture and more delicate goods.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What's the Differences Between Antique vs. Vintage vs. Retro
